intro: Cheirolophus ghomerythus, commonly known as the Ethiopian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark purple disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitat.
